channel.title: How did you hear about Auxy?
channel.description:
Just wondering. I saw the Youtuber ‘Andrew Huang’ using it and needed to check it out instantly..
So. That happened.
You?

item.title: How did you hear about Auxy?
item.dc:creator: MisterMaster
item.description:
Do you remember how you discovered Auxy?

I’m looking at ways to improve the forum and it would be useful to understand how you first discovered this awesome music app.

I can’t remember how I discovered it myself, but would be interested to know if any of you can remember?

Read full topic
item.source: How did you hear about Auxy?

item.title: How did you hear about Auxy?
item.dc:creator: BlaMeese
item.description:
Pretty sure I was looking for a music making/mixing app on my phone for no reason and i saw it and decided to get it. I didn’t even make music at the time but I thought it would be fun to try. Also I’ve had a bunch of people ask me about Auxy and I know someone is planning on joining soon so that’s a way people find it to.

Edit: I stoped using Auxy for a couple months and then I saw Andrew Huang’s video on it and I started making stuff on it a gain.

Read full topic
item.source: How did you hear about Auxy?

item.description:
some dude on Gamepress forums said he used it to make music for his games

item.title: How did you hear about Auxy?
item.dc:creator: Pinewoodog
item.description:
It suited my workflow much better. It’s really easy to put down ideas quickly in Ableton, as you don’t have to use “musical typing” or whatever, and the settings allow for clicking to place down a midi note vs selecting the brush tool. Also, the clips are awesome, and it allows you to create music in a D-J like fashion. Plus, all the effects are automatically organized in Ableton and all the windows fit on one screen. The only reasons Logic could be better is because 1) It comes with a lot of free synths and sounds and 2) the interface is pretty

Read full topic
item.source: How did you hear about Auxy?

item.title: How did you hear about Auxy?
item.dc:creator: Arimyth
item.description:
My Dad showed it to me. He’s into electronic music (especially mobile), so it was right up his ally.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.source: How did you hear about Auxy?

item.title: How did you hear about Auxy?
item.dc:creator: Pinewoodog
item.description:
About a year ago Inwas looking for an app on my iPad that I could make “real music” with, and I found the green-logoed Auxy. I made some pretty trash songs with it, then left it for GarageBand and eventually Logic. When I converted to Ableton, I downloaded the white-logoed Auxy and liked it a lot. Now, it’s pretty much my main DAW.

Read full topic
item.source: How did you hear about Auxy?

item.description:
I was just looking through the music section of the app store, and I found Auxy. The rest is history.

item.title: How did you hear about Auxy?
item.dc:creator: BALLISTIK
item.description:
I got sick of GarageBand for iOS, and wanted more sounds, so I went searching on the App Store, and found Auxy (the old iPad version.) It also happened that the next day I was going to be on a long car ride to the beach, so I had plenty of time to try it out.

Read full topic

item.title: How did you hear about Auxy?
item.dc:creator: ST3R30
item.description:
Browsing through the App Store looking for music making apps, when I found Auxy. Downloaded it, was like “this sucks” and then deleted it. A few months later I came across it again and gave it another try, and was like “hey this is actually pretty good”.

Read full topic

item.title: How did you hear about Auxy?
item.dc:creator: DontPartyWithGuns
item.description:
I was trying to find an alternative DAW (i…e. i was going on a roadtrip without my computer and I still wanted to make music) and I download like 5 apps. Out of all of them, Auxy seemed the most promising, so I kept it.

Read full topic
item.source: How did you hear about Auxy?

item.title: How did you hear about Auxy?
item.dc:creator: TXA
item.description:
Well, I guess it was a complicated story. One day I found Auxy on the App Store and decided to try it out though I didn’t like it very much. Then after experimenting and making trash I decided I hated it. Then the revolutiionary update came out and I absolutely loved it and I actually started to make half decent stuff. Then that led to where I am now.

Read full topic
item.source: How did you hear about Auxy?

item.title: How did you hear about Auxy?
item.dc:creator: Dj_Peloton
item.description:
I’ve been composing for piano since I was nine, wanted something more than just piano so I downloaded things like the albetton launchpad app, and a bunch of other albetton apps. But I Still wasn’t satisfied so I went scrolling… like most of you I stumbled apon Auxy, and I’ve been here since

Read full topic
item.source: How did you hear about Auxy?

item.title: How did you hear about Auxy?
item.dc:creator: Trey
item.description:
Scrolling through the App Store, and I was attracted to its color scheme. I listened to s0phonts protocol and was like, “how did he do that??!?” So I’ve been making ever since.

Read full topic

item.title: How did you hear about Auxy?
item.dc:creator: Xicon
item.description:
1. I saw auxy in the AppStore and tried it. It was hard as frick then, so I quickly chose MusicMakerJam over Auxy. That didn’t end long.
  2. It is basically how @El1011 found Auxy. I was scrolling through the AppStore when I found it again. And look where I’m at now.

Read full topic
